Name: Gateway of India
Nearest Airport: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (35 km)
Accessibility: Fully accessible by road, wheelchair-friendly
Parking: Available at nearby paid parking areas (₹20-50 per hour)
Nearby Amenities: Leopold Cafe, Taj Hotel restaurants, public restrooms, souvenir shops
Special Notes: Icon of Mumbai, built in 1924, boat rides to Elephanta Caves available from here

Name: Elephanta Caves
Type: UNESCO World Heritage Site / Cave Temples
Nearest Railway Station: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (13 km + ferry)
Nearest Airport: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (48 km)
Accessibility: Ferry ride required (1 hour), moderate climbing involved, not fully wheelchair accessible
Guided Tours: ASI certified guides available; ₹500-1000 per group
Parking: Available at Gateway of India jetty (₹30-80)
Nearby Amenities: Basic refreshments on island, restaurants at Gateway of India
Special Notes: 6th-7th century Hindu caves, famous Trimurti sculpture, toy train available on island

Name: Marine Drive
Nearest Airport: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (28 km)
Accessibility: Fully accessible, wide walkways, wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Not required, self-guided walking tours available
Parking: Limited street parking, paid parking areas nearby (₹20-40 per hour)
Nearby Amenities: Cafe Mocha, street food vendors, public seating, restrooms
Special Notes: Known as 'Queen's Necklace' for its lights, 3.6 km arc-shaped boulevard

Name: Siddhivinayak Temple
Nearest Airport: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (20 km)
Accessibility: Wheelchair accessible, ramp facility available
Guided Tours: Not required, temple volunteers provide information
Nearby Amenities: Prasad counters, restrooms, book stalls, nearby restaurants
Special Notes: Famous Ganesh temple, attracts millions of devotees, Tuesday rush hours

Name: Mahabaleshwar
Accessibility: Good road connectivity, some viewpoints require short walks
Nearby Amenities: Mapro Garden, hotels, restaurants, strawberry farms, boat clubs
Special Notes: Queen of Sahyadris, strawberry cultivation, Krishna River origin point

Name: Lonavala
Best Time to Visit: June to October - Monsoon beauty; December to February
Accessibility: Excellent road and rail connectivity, moderate trekking required for some spots
Nearby Amenities: Chikki shops, restaurants, resorts, local markets
Special Notes: Famous for chikki (sweet), monsoon waterfalls, weekend getaway from Mumbai-Pune

Name: Matheran
Nearest Bus Stand: Dasturi Naka (2 km from main market)
Nearest Airport: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (90 km)
Entry Fee: Vehicle prohibited; Horse ride ₹300-800; Toy train ₹295
Accessibility: Vehicle-free zone, horses/walking only, moderate fitness required
Nearby Amenities: Heritage hotels, restaurants, horse operators, viewpoint kiosks
Special Notes: Asia's only automobile-free hill station, red soil, panoramic valley views

Name: Panchgani
Entry Fee: Entry to some points like Table Land, Parsi Point; ₹20-50
Accessibility: Good road connectivity, some steps/climbing at Table Land
Nearby Amenities: Viewpoints, market, Parsi Point, Sydney Point, hotels, restaurants
Special Notes: Famous for Table Land (Asia's 2nd largest plateau), strawberry farms, scenic views

Name: Ajanta Caves
Type: UNESCO World Heritage Site / Buddhist Caves
Accessibility: Bus shuttle to caves, some climbing required, not wheelchair accessible
Nearby Amenities: Cafeteria, souvenir shops, restrooms at entrance
Special Notes: 29 rock-cut Buddhist caves (2nd century BCE to 480 CE), famous for murals and frescoes

Name: Ellora Caves
Type: UNESCO World Heritage Site / Cave Temples
Accessibility: Paved pathways, partially wheelchair accessible (main temples)
Nearby Amenities: Basic refreshments, restrooms, souvenir shops
Special Notes: 34 rock-cut caves (600-1000 CE), blend of Buddhist, Hindu, Jain art, Kailasa Temple

Name: Shaniwar Wada
Entry Fee: Indians ₹15, Foreigners ₹200; Light and Sound Show ₹50
Accessibility: Partially wheelchair accessible, paved pathways
Parking: Available at nearby paid parking lots (₹20-50)
Nearby Amenities: Local eateries, historic Peth areas, souvenir shops
Special Notes: Seat of Peshwas of Maratha Empire, famed for its architectural grandeur, light and sound show

Name: Alibaug
Nearest Airport: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (100 km)
Timings: Most beaches 24 hours; Kolaba Fort 10 AM to 5 PM (tide dependent)
Entry Fee: Kolaba Fort ₹5; Ferry from Mumbai ₹300 return
Accessibility: Good road connectivity, beach areas are accessible
Nearby Amenities: Water sports, resorts, local eateries, Kolaba Fort
Special Notes: Popular weekend getaway from Mumbai, Kolaba Fort is a sea fortress

Name: Ganpatipule
Timings: Temple 5 AM to 9 PM; Beach 24 hours
Accessibility: Good road access, accessible beach and temple premises
Nearby Amenities: Temple facilities, local seafood restaurants, resorts, souvenir shops
Special Notes: Swayambhu (self-originated) Ganesha idol, pristine beach, Aam-panhas

Name: Tarkarli
Accessibility: Good road connectivity, accessible beaches
Guided Tours: Scuba diving instructors and water sports operators available
Nearby Amenities: MTDC resorts, homestays, local seafood restaurants
Special Notes: Known for clear water, scuba diving, and snorkelling, backwaters

Name: Shirdi
Accessibility: Fully wheelchair accessible, ramps and lifts available
Nearby Amenities: Dharamshalas, restaurants, prasadalaya, book stalls
Special Notes: Shrine of Sai Baba, major pilgrimage center, attracts millions of devotees

Name: Trimbakeshwar Shiva Temple
Accessibility: Partially wheelchair accessible, some steps involved
Nearby Amenities: Brahma Giri Hill, restaurants, souvenir shops
Special Notes: One of the 12 Jyotirlingas, source of Godavari River, black stone temple

Name: Tadoba Andhari Tiger Reserve
Timings: Safari timings: 6 AM to 11 AM; 2 PM to 6 PM
Best Time to Visit: October to May (April-May for best tiger sightings)
Accessibility: Jeep safaris available, not wheelchair accessible
Guided Tours: Mandatory forest guide with every safari jeep
Nearby Amenities: Resorts, eco-lodges, basic refreshments at gate
Special Notes: Maharashtra's largest and oldest national park, highest tiger density in India

Name: Sanjay Gandhi National Park
Nearest Airport: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (18 km)
Accessibility: Accessible pathways, some attractions require walking
Guided Tours: Tiger & Lion safari available (₹60 per person)
Nearby Amenities: Cafeteria, Kanheri Caves, toy train, boating facilities
Special Notes: Unique urban national park, home to Kanheri Caves and diverse wildlife

Name: Bhandardara
Entry Fee: Free; some spots like Arthur Lake have boating charges
Best Time to Visit: June to September - Monsoon waterfalls; October to February
Accessibility: Good road connectivity, some treks required for viewpoints
Nearby Amenities: Arthur Lake, Wilson Dam, Randha Falls, Mount Kalsubai
Special Notes: Highest peak in Maharashtra (Kalsubai), camping, waterfalls, firefly viewing in monsoon

Name: Chikhaldara
Accessibility: Good road connectivity, some viewpoints require short walks
Guided Tours: Local guides available for forest tours ₹400-800
Nearby Amenities: Gavilgad Fort, Tiger Point, Bhimkund, Melghat Tiger Reserve
Special Notes: Only coffee-growing area in Maharashtra, mythological significance (Mahabharata)

Name: Kaas Plateau
Type: UNESCO World Heritage Site / Plateau of Flowers
Accessibility: Road access, well-marked pathways, partially wheelchair accessible
Nearby Amenities: Kaas Lake, basic refreshments, local food stalls
Special Notes: Valley of Flowers of Maharashtra, over 850 species of flowering plants, UNESCO site since 2012

Name: Raigad Fort
Type: Historical Fort / Capital of Maratha Empire
Nearest Airport: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (140 km)
Accessibility: Ropeway available, otherwise 1.5-2 hour trek with 1737 steps
Nearby Amenities: Ropeway station facilities, restrooms, local eateries
Special Notes: Capital of Chhatrapati Shivaji's kingdom, significant monument of Maratha history

Name: Pratapgad Fort
Accessibility: 200-300 steps to climb, not wheelchair accessible
Nearby Amenities: Bhavani Temple, Afzal Khan's tomb, basic eateries at base
Special Notes: Built by Shivaji, famous for the Battle of Pratapgad, significant historical monument

Name: Nashik
Timings: Most temples: 6 AM to 9 PM; Wineries 10 AM to 6 PM
Accessibility: Good road connectivity, most places are accessible
Nearby Amenities: Temples, vineyards, Godavari River Ghats, restaurants
Special Notes: Holy city on Godavari River, one of the four Kumbh Mela sites, wine capital of India

Name: Kolhapur
Accessibility: Good road connectivity, temple is accessible
Guided Tours: Local guides for temples and palace available ₹300-600
Nearby Amenities: Mahalaxmi Temple, New Palace, Rankala Lake, local cuisine
Special Notes: Known for Mahalaxmi Temple, chappals (footwear), and local spicy cuisine (Kolhapuri)

Name: Dudhsagar Falls
Entry Fee: Forest entry ₹50; Jeep safari ₹500-800 per person
Best Time to Visit: November to May (jeep safari available); Monsoon for full flow (trek only)
Accessibility: Jeep safari or trek required, not wheelchair accessible
Guided Tours: Jeep safaris from Kulem with driver-guide
Nearby Amenities: Basic refreshments at Kulem and base of falls
Special Notes: One of India's tallest waterfalls, located on Mandovi River, 'Sea of Milk'

Name: Bibi Ka Maqbara
Best Time to Visit: October to March - Pleasant weather for outdoor exploration
Accessibility: Well-maintained pathways, wheelchair accessible main areas
Nearby Amenities: Cafeteria, restrooms, souvenir shops
Special Notes: Mini Taj Mahal, built by Aurangzeb's son, Mughal architecture, wife of Aurangzeb's tomb

Name: Aga Khan Palace
Best Time to Visit: October to March - Comfortable weather for historical exploration
Accessibility: Wheelchair accessible, ramps available
Nearby Amenities: Gandhi museum, gardens, restrooms, book store
Special Notes: Gandhi's prison, Kasturba Gandhi's samadhi, freedom struggle memorial, Italian architecture

Name: Daulatabad Fort
Best Time to Visit: October to March - Suitable for fort climbing
Accessibility: Steep climb required, not wheelchair accessible, moderate to difficult trek
Nearby Amenities: Basic refreshments, restrooms at entrance
Special Notes: Devagiri Fort, Tughlaq capital, complex defense systems, panoramic views

Name: Panchakki
Accessibility: Mostly accessible, some steps around mill area
Nearby Amenities: Tomb complex, gardens, restrooms
Special Notes: 17th-century water mill, Aulia's dargah, unique engineering, still functional

Name: Sindhudurg Fort
Best Time to Visit: October to May - Calm sea conditions
Accessibility: Boat ride required, some climbing on fort
Nearby Amenities: Malvan town facilities, seafood restaurants
Special Notes: Built by Shivaji in Arabian Sea, maritime heritage, architectural marvel

Name: Aurangabad Caves
Best Time to Visit: October to March - Comfortable cave exploration weather
Accessibility: Some climbing required, partially wheelchair accessible
Nearby Amenities: Basic facilities, university campus nearby
Special Notes: 12 Buddhist caves (6th-7th century), less crowded alternative to Ajanta-Ellora

Name: Deekshabhoomi
Best Time to Visit: October to March - Comfortable weather; October 14 for special celebrations
Accessibility: Fully wheelchair accessible, ramp facilities
Guided Tours: Volunteers provide information about Buddhist history
Nearby Amenities: Buddhist center, library, meditation halls, cafeteria
Special Notes: Dr. B.R. Ambedkar's conversion site, largest hollow stupa globally, Buddhist pilgrimage center

Name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus
Type: UNESCO World Heritage Site / Railway Station
Nearest Airport: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (30 km)
Entry Fee: Free for station access; Platform ticket ₹10
Best Time to Visit: October to March - Pleasant weather for exterior appreciation
Accessibility: Fully accessible as active railway station
Nearby Amenities: Station facilities, restaurants, shopping areas
Special Notes: Victorian Gothic architecture, UNESCO site since 2004, active railway terminus

Name: Lal Mahal
Timings: 8 AM to 12 PM, 4 PM to 8 PM
Best Time to Visit: October to March - Pleasant sightseeing weather
Accessibility: Ground level access, wheelchair friendly
Nearby Amenities: Kasba Peth area, local restaurants, historic neighborhood
Special Notes: Shivaji's childhood residence, Maratha heritage, reconstructed palace, museum artifacts

Name: Karla Caves
Best Time to Visit: October to March - Pleasant weather for cave exploration
Accessibility: Steps and moderate climb required, not wheelchair accessible
Nearby Amenities: Local tea stalls, basic refreshments, Ekvira Devi temple
Special Notes: Largest chaitya hall in India (2nd century BCE), intricate carvings, ancient Buddhist site

Name: Bhaja Caves
Best Time to Visit: October to March - Comfortable cave visiting weather
Accessibility: Steep climb required, moderate difficulty, not wheelchair accessible
Nearby Amenities: Village tea stalls, basic facilities
Special Notes: 22 rock-cut caves (2nd century BCE), oldest Buddhist caves in Maharashtra, stupas

Name: Khandala
Entry Fee: Most viewpoints free; Some private spots charge ₹10-20
Best Time to Visit: June to September - Monsoon beauty; October to February - Pleasant weather
Accessibility: Good road connectivity, some viewpoints require short walks
Nearby Amenities: Duke's Nose viewpoint, resorts, restaurants, local markets
Special Notes: Twin hill station with Lonavala, Duke's Nose, reversing station, shooting location

Name: Amboli
Entry Fee: Most spots free; Some private viewpoints ₹10-30
Best Time to Visit: June to September - Peak waterfall season; October to February - Clear weather
Accessibility: Good road access, some waterfalls require short treks
Nearby Amenities: MTDC resort, forest guest house, local eateries
Special Notes: Last hill station of Maharashtra, 7 waterfalls, misty weather, Western Ghats biodiversity

Name: Rajgad Fort
Timings: Trek possible 24 hours; Best: 6 AM to 6 PM
Best Time to Visit: October to February - Good trekking weather; avoid monsoons
Accessibility: 2-3 hour moderate to difficult trek required
Nearby Amenities: Base village refreshments, camping possible
Special Notes: Shivaji's capital for 26 years, king of forts, challenging trek, panoramic views

Name: Torna Fort
Best Time to Visit: October to March - Ideal trekking conditions
Accessibility: 2-3 hour moderate trek through rocky terrain
Nearby Amenities: Village tea stalls, basic camping facilities
Special Notes: First fort captured by Shivaji (1643), historic significance, steep climb required

Name: Lavasa
Timings: City access 24 hours; Activities: 9 AM to 6 PM
Entry Fee: City entry free; Individual activity charges vary
Best Time to Visit: October to March - Pleasant weather; June to September - Monsoon charm
Accessibility: Excellent road connectivity, wheelchair accessible facilities
Nearby Amenities: Hotels, restaurants, adventure sports, shopping promenade
Special Notes: India's first planned hill city, Italian architecture, water sports, controversy over construction

Name: Pawna Lake
Timings: 24 hours access; Best camping: Evening to morning
Entry Fee: Lake access free; Camping ₹800-2000 per person
Best Time to Visit: October to March - Perfect camping weather; avoid monsoons
Accessibility: Good approach road, lakeside camping areas accessible
Guided Tours: Camping operators provide guidance and equipment
Nearby Amenities: Camping operators, barbecue facilities, water sports equipment
Special Notes: Artificial reservoir, weekend camping destination, water sports, scenic sunsets

Name: Rajmachi Fort
Timings: Best trek timing: 6 AM to 6 PM
Best Time to Visit: October to February - Good trekking; June to September - Green monsoon trek
Accessibility: 2-3 hour moderate trek through forest
Nearby Amenities: Village homestays, basic refreshments, camping possible
Special Notes: Twin forts Shrivardhan and Manaranjan, monsoon trek popular, firefly viewing season

Name: Murud-Janjira Fort
Nearest Airport: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (165 km)
Timings: 8 AM to 6 PM (boat service dependent on tide)
Best Time to Visit: October to March - Calm sea, good boat access
Accessibility: Boat ride required, some climbing on fort ruins
Nearby Amenities: Murud beach, local seafood restaurants, guest houses
Special Notes: Unconquered island fort, Siddi naval base, unique architecture, Arabian Sea fortress
